Pilate and Herod suddenly became friends because

options.B: Pilate referred Jesus to Herod who had wanted to see him
options.C: Herod sent Jesus back to Pilate

explanation: According to Luke 23:6-12, during the trial of Jesus, Pontius Pilate, the Roman governor of Judea, sent Jesus to Herod Antipas because Jesus was from Galilee, which fell under Herod's jurisdiction. Herod had expressed a desire to see Jesus, possibly out of curiosity or to witness miracles, but Jesus remained silent before Herod. After some interaction, Herod sent Jesus back to Pilate, and it was during this time that Pilate and Herod, who had previously been at odds, became friends.
